    PLATFORM APPS

      ASSET MANAGEMENT

    • CyberSecurity Asset Management (CSAM)

      See entire attack surface, continuously maintain your CMDB, and track EOL/EOS software

    • External Attack Surface Management (EASM) - New

      Gain an attacker’s view of your external internet-facing assets and unauthorized software

      • Vulnerability & Configuration Management

    • Vulnerability Management, Detection & Response (VMDR) - Most Popular

      Discover, assess, prioritize, and patch critical vulnerabilities up to 50% faster

    • Enterprise TruRisk Management (ETM) - New

      Consolidate & translate security & vulnerability findings from 3rd party tools

    • Web App Scanning (WAS)

      Automate scanning in CI/CD environments with shift left DAST testing

    • Cloud Workload Protection (CWP)

      Detect, prioritize, and remediate vulnerabilities in your cloud environment

      • Risk REMEDIATION

    • Patch Management (PM)

      Efficiently remediate vulnerabilities and patch systems

    • Custom Assessment and Remediation (CAR)

      Quickly create custom scripts and controls for faster, more automated remediation

      • Threat Detection and Response

    • Multi-Vector EDR

      Advanced endpoint threat protection, improved threat context, and alert prioritization

    • Context XDR

      Extend detection and response beyond the endpoint to the enterprise

      • Compliance

    • Policy Compliance

      Reduce risk, and comply with internal policies and external regulations with ease

    • File Integrity Monitoring (FIM)

      Reduce alert noise and safeguard files from nefarious actors and cyber threats

      • Cloud Security

    • TotalCloud (CNAPP)

      Cloud-Native Application Protection Platform (CNAPP) for multi-cloud environment.

    • Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM)

      Continuously discover, monitor, and analyze your cloud assets for misconfigurations and non-standard deployments.

    • Infrastructure as Code Security (IaC)

      Detect and remediate security issues within IaC templates

    • SaaS Security Posture Management (SSPM) - New

      Manage your security posture and risk across your entire SaaS application stack

    • Cloud Workload Protection (CWP)

      Detect, prioritize, and remediate vulnerabilities in your cloud environment

    • Cloud Detection and Response (CDR)

      Continuous real-time protection of the multi-cloud environment against active exploitation, malware, and unknown threats.

    • Container Security (CS)

      Discover, track, and continuously secure containers – from build to runtime

Cyber Risk Series | Cloud Security Edition | February 28 | Register Now

Microsoft security alert.

August 11, 2015

Advisory overview

Qualys Vulnerability R&D Lab has released new vulnerability checks in the Enterprise TruRisk Platform to protect organizations against 52 vulnerabilities that were fixed in 14 bulletins announced today by Microsoft. Customers can immediately audit their networks for these and other new vulnerabilities by accessing their Qualys subscription. Visit Qualys Security Blog to prioritize remediation.

Non-Qualys customers can audit their network for these and other vulnerabilities by signing up for a Qualys Free Trial, or by trying Qualys Community Edition.

Vulnerability details

Microsoft has released 14 security bulletins to fix newly discovered flaws in their software. Qualys has released the following checks for these new vulnerabilities:

  • Microsoft System Center Operations Manager Privilege Elevation Vulnerability (MS15-086)

    Severity
    Critical 4
    Qualys ID
    91076
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-086
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-2420
    CVSS Scores
    Base 4.3 / Temporal 3.2
    Description
    An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Microsoft System Center Operations Manager that is caused by the improper validation of input.

    Microsoft has released a security update that addresses the vulnerability by modifying how System Center Operations Manager accepts input.

    This security update is rated Important for affected versions of Microsoft System Center 2012 Operations Manager and Microsoft System Center 2012 Operations Manager R2.

    Consequence
    The vulnerability could allow elevation of privilege if a user visits an affected website by way of a specially crafted URL.
    Solution
    Refer to MS15-086 for more information.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS15-086 Microsoft System Center 2012 Operations Manager
    MS15-086 Microsoft System Center 2012 Operations Manager R2
    MS15-086 Microsoft System Center 2012 Operations Manager Service Pack 1

  • Microsoft Windows Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (MS15-090)

    Severity
    Critical 4
    Qualys ID
    91083
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-090
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-2428, CVE-2015-2429, CVE-2015-2430
    CVSS Scores
    Base 9.3 / Temporal 6.9
    Description
    The security update addresses the vulnerabilities by correcting how Windows Object Manager handles object symbolic links created by a sandbox process, by preventing improper interaction with the registry by sandboxed applications, and by preventing improper interaction with the filesystem by sandboxed applications.
    Consequence
    The vulnerabilities could allow elevation of privilege if an attacker logs on to an affected system and runs a specially crafted application or convinces a user to open a specially crafted file that invokes a vulnerable sandboxed application, allowing an attacker to escape the sandbox.
    Solution
    Refer to MS15-090 to obtain more information.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS15-090 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-090 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-090 Windows 8 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-090 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems
    MS15-090 Windows 8.1 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-090 Windows 8.1 for x64-based Systems
    MS15-090 Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-090 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-090 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-090 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-090 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-090 Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-090 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-090 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-090 Windows Server 2012
    MS15-090 Windows Server 2012
    MS15-090 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS15-090 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS15-090 Windows Vista Service Pack 2
    MS15-090 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2

  • Microsoft Internet Explorer Cumulative Security Update (MS15-079)

    Severity
    Urgent 5
    Qualys ID
    100247
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-079
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-2423, CVE-2015-2441, CVE-2015-2442, CVE-2015-2443, CVE-2015-2444, CVE-2015-2445, CVE-2015-2446, CVE-2015-2447, CVE-2015-2448, CVE-2015-2449, CVE-2015-2450, CVE-2015-2451, CVE-2015-2452
    CVSS Scores
    Base 9.3 / Temporal 7.7
    Description
    Microsoft Internet Explorer is a graphical web browser developed by Microsoft and included as part of the Microsoft Windows operating systems.

    This security update resolves vulnerabilities in Internet Explorer. Remote code execution vulnerabilities exist when Internet Explorer improperly accesses objects in memory. These vulnerabilities could corrupt memory in such a way that an attacker could execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user.

    Security feature bypass vulnerabilities exist when Internet Explorer fails to use the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) security feature, allowing an attacker to more reliably predict the memory offsets of specific instructions in a given call stack.

    An information disclosure vulnerability exists in Microsoft Windows, Internet Explorer, and Microsoft Office when files at a medium integrity level become accessible to Internet Explorer running in Enhanced Protection Mode (EPM).

    This security update is rated Critical for Internet Explorer 7 (IE 7), Internet Explorer 8 (IE 8), Internet Explorer 9 (IE 9), Internet Explorer 10 (IE 10), and Internet Explorer 11 (IE 11) on affected Windows clients, and Moderate for Internet Explorer 6 (IE 6), Internet Explorer 7 (IE 7), Internet Explorer 8 (IE 8), Internet Explorer 9 (IE 9), Internet Explorer 10 (IE 10), and Internet Explorer 11 (IE 11) on affected Windows servers.

    Consequence
    Successful exploitation allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code.
    Solution
    Refer to Microsoft Security Bulletin MS15-079 for details.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS15-079 Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-079 Windows 10 for x64-based Systems
    MS15-079 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 10)
    MS15-079 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 11)
    MS15-079 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS15-079 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 9)
    MS15-079 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 10)
    MS15-079 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 11)
    MS15-079 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS15-079 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 9)
    MS15-079 Windows 8 for 32-bit Systems(Internet Explorer 10)
    MS15-079 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems(Internet Explorer 10)
    MS15-079 Windows 8.1 for 32-bit Systems(Internet Explorer 11)
    MS15-079 Windows 8.1 for x64-based Systems(Internet Explorer 11)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 10)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 11)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 9)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 9)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 9)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2012(Internet Explorer 10)
    MS15-079 Windows Server 2012 R2(Internet Explorer 11)
    MS15-079 Windows Vista Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS15-079 Windows Vista Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS15-079 Windows Vista Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 9)
    MS15-079 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS15-079 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS15-079 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 9)

  • Microsoft Graphics Component Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (MS15-080)

    Severity
    Urgent 5
    Qualys ID
    91085
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-080
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-2431, CVE-2015-2432, CVE-2015-2433, CVE-2015-2435, CVE-2015-2453, CVE-2015-2454, CVE-2015-2455, CVE-2015-2456, CVE-2015-2458, CVE-2015-2459, CVE-2015-2460, CVE-2015-2461, CVE-2015-2462, CVE-2015-2463, CVE-2015-2464, CVE-2015-2465
    CVSS Scores
    Base 9.3 / Temporal 7.7
    Description
    This security update resolves vulnerabilities in Microsoft Windows, Microsoft .NET Framework, Microsoft Office, Microsoft Lync, and Microsoft Silverlight. The most severe of the vulnerabilities could allow remote code execution if a user opens a specially crafted document or visits an untrusted webpage that contains embedded TrueType or OpenType fonts.

    This security update is rated Critical.

    Consequence
    An attacker who successfully exploited these vulnerabilities could take complete control of the affected system.
    Solution
    Please refer to MS15-080 for more details.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS15-080 Microsoft Live Meeting 2007 Console
    MS15-080 Microsoft Lync 2010
    MS15-080 Microsoft Lync 2010
    MS15-080 Microsoft Lync 2010 Attendee
    MS15-080 Microsoft Lync 2010 Attendee
    MS15-080 Microsoft Lync 2013 Service Pack 1
    MS15-080 Microsoft Lync 2013 Service Pack 1
    MS15-080 Microsoft Lync Basic 2013 Service Pack 1
    MS15-080 Microsoft Lync Basic 2013 Service Pack 1
    MS15-080 Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3
    MS15-080 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2
    MS15-080 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2
    MS15-080 Microsoft Silverlight 5
    MS15-080 Microsoft Silverlight 5 Developer Runtime
    MS15-080 Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5)
    MS15-080 Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-080 Windows 10 for 64-bit Systems(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5)
    MS15-080 Windows 10 for x64-based Systems
    MS15-080 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5.1)
    MS15-080 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-080 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5.1)
    MS15-080 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-080 Windows 8 for 32-bit Systems(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5)
    MS15-080 Windows 8 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-080 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5)
    MS15-080 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems
    MS15-080 Windows 8.1 for 32-bit Systems(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5)
    MS15-080 Windows 8.1 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-080 Windows 8.1 for x64-based Systems(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5)
    MS15-080 Windows 8.1 for x64-based Systems
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5.1)
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1 (Server Core installation)(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5.1)
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.0 Service Pack 2)
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4)
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5/4.5.1/4.5.2)
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.0 Service Pack 2)
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4)
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5/4.5.1/4.5.2)
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2012(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5)
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2012
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2012 (Server Core installation)(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5)
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2012 R2(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5)
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS15-080 Windows Server 2012 R2 (Server Core installation)(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5)
    MS15-080 Windows Vista Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.0 Service Pack 2)
    MS15-080 Windows Vista Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4)
    MS15-080 Windows Vista Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5/4.5.1/4.5.2)
    MS15-080 Windows Vista Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-080 Windows Vista Service Pack 2
    MS15-080 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 3.0 Service Pack 2)
    MS15-080 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4)
    MS15-080 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5/4.5.1/4.5.2)
    MS15-080 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-080 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2

  • Microsoft Office Multiple Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities (MS15-081)

    Severity
    Urgent 5
    Qualys ID
    110258
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-081
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-1642, CVE-2015-2423, CVE-2015-2466, CVE-2015-2467, CVE-2015-2468, CVE-2015-2469, CVE-2015-2470, CVE-2015-2477
    CVSS Scores
    Base 9.3 / Temporal 8.1
    Description
    Microsoft Office is prone to the following vulnerabilities:

    Multiple remote code execution vulnerabilities exist in Microsoft Office software when the Office software fails to properly handle objects in memory.

    An information disclosure vulnerability exists in Microsoft Windows, Internet Explorer, and Microsoft Office when files at a medium integrity level become accessible to Internet Explorer running in Enhanced Protection Mode (EPM).

    A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Microsoft Office software when the Office software fails to properly validate templates.

    A remote code execution vulnerability exists when Office decreases an integer value beyond its intended minimum value.

    Microsoft has released a security update that addresses the vulnerabilities by correcting how Office handles files in memory, improving how Microsoft Office programs are executed from Internet Explorer, correcting how Office validates Office templates prior to use and by correcting how Office handles integer bounds checking.

    Consequence
    The most severe of the vulnerabilities could allow remote code execution if a user opens a specially crafted Microsoft Office file. An attacker who successfully exploits the vulnerabilities could run arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Customers whose accounts are configured to have fewer user rights on the system could be less impacted than those who operate with administrative user rights.
    Solution
    Refer to MS15-081 to obtain more information.

    Microsoft Security Guidance for more details pertaining to this vulnerability.

    Microsoft Security Guidance for more details pertaining to this vulnerability.

    MacOS Release Notes
    Office Click-2-Run and Office 365 Release Notes
    Workaround:
    1) Remove the IE elevation policies for Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS15-081 Microsoft Excel 2007 Service Pack 3
    MS15-081 Microsoft Excel 2010 Service Pack 2 (32-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Excel 2010 Service Pack 2 (64-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Excel 2013 Service Pack 1 (32-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Excel 2013 Service Pack 1 (64-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (32-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (32-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (32-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (32-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (64-bit editions
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (64-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (64-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (64-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2013 Service Pack 1 (32-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2013 Service Pack 1 (32-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2013 Service Pack 1 (32-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2013 Service Pack 1 (64-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2013 Service Pack 1 (64-bit editions)
    MS15-081 Microsoft Office 2013 Service Pack 1 (64-bit editions)

  • Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Protocol Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (MS15-082)

    Severity
    Critical 4
    Qualys ID
    91081
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-082
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-2472, CVE-2015-2473
    CVSS Scores
    Base 9.3 / Temporal 6.9
    Description
    Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) lets users create a virtual session on their desktop computers. RDP allows remote users to access all of the data and applications on their computer system.

    A remote code execution vulnerability exists when Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Protocol client improperly handles the loading of crafted DLL files.

    A spoofing vulnerability exists when the Remote Desktop Session Host (RDSH) improperly validates certificates during authentication.

    This security update is rated Important for all supported editions of Windows Vista, Windows Server 2008, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012, Widnows RT and Windows RT 8.1

    QID Detection Logic:(Authenticated)
    This QID checks for a vulnerable file version of Mstscax.dll.

    Consequence
    The vulnerability can be exploited to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the current user.
    Solution
    Customers are advised to refer to Microsoft Advisory MS15-082 for more details.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS15-082 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-082 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-082 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-082 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-082 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-082 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-082 Windows 8 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-082 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems
    MS15-082 Windows 8.1 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-082 Windows 8.1 for x64-based Systems
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2012
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2012
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS15-082 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS15-082 Windows Vista Service Pack 2
    MS15-082 Windows Vista Service Pack 2
    MS15-082 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    MS15-082 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2

  • Microsoft SMB Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (MS15-083)

    Severity
    Critical 4
    Qualys ID
    91080
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-083
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-2474
    CVSS Scores
    Base 9 / Temporal 7
    Description
    Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol is a Microsoft network file sharing protocol used in Microsoft Windows.

    An authenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists when the Server Message Block (SMB) improperly handles crafted logging activities, resulting in memory corruption.

    This security update is rated Important for all supported editions of Windows Vista, Windows Server 2008.

    Consequence
    Successfully exploiting this vulnerability might allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code.

    Solution
    Customers are advised to refer to Microsoft Advisory MS15-083 for more details.

    Workaround:
    TCP ports 139 and 445 should be blocked at the firewall to protect systems behind the firewall from attempts to exploit this vulnerability.
    Impact of workaround: Blocking the ports can cause several windows services or applications using those ports to stop functioning.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS15-083 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-083 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-083 Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-083 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-083 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-083 Windows Vista Service Pack 2
    MS15-083 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2

  • Microsoft XML Core Services Information Disclosure Vulnerabilities (MS15-084)

    Severity
    Serious 3
    Qualys ID
    123796
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-084
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-2434, CVE-2015-2440, CVE-2015-2471
    CVSS Scores
    Base 4.3 / Temporal 3.2
    Description
    Microsoft XML Core Services (MSXML) allows customers who use JScript, Visual Basic Scripting Edition (VBScript), and Microsoft Visual Studio 6.0 to develop XML-based applications that provide interoperability with other applications that adhere to the XML 1.0 standard.

    This security update resolves vulnerabilities in Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Office. The vulnerabilities could allow information disclosure by either exposing memory addresses if a user clicks a specially crafted link or by explicitly allowing the use of Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) 2.0.

    This security update is rated Important for the following software:
    - Microsoft XML Core Services 3.0 and Microsoft XML Core Services 6.0 on all supported releases of Microsoft Windows except Windows 10, which is not affected.
    - Microsoft XML Core Services 5.0 on Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3
    - Microsoft XML Core Services 5.0 on Microsoft InfoPath 2007 Service Pack 3

    Consequence
    Successfully exploiting these vulnerabilities might allow a remote attacker to obtain information in an attempt to further compromise the affected system.
    Solution
    Refer to Microsoft Security Bulletin MS15-084 for details.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS15-084 Microsoft InfoPath 2007 Service Pack 3
    MS15-084 Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3
    MS15-084 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-084 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-084 Windows 8 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-084 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems
    MS15-084 Windows 8.1 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-084 Windows 8.1 for x64-based Systems
    MS15-084 Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-084 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-084 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-084 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-084 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-084 Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-084 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-084 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-084 Windows Server 2012
    MS15-084 Windows Server 2012
    MS15-084 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS15-084 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS15-084 Windows Vista Service Pack 2
    MS15-084 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2

  • Microsoft Windows Mount Manager Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (MS15-085)

    Severity
    Critical 4
    Qualys ID
    91079
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-085
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-1769
    CVSS Scores
    Base 7.2 / Temporal 6.3
    Description
    An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when the Mount Manager component improperly processes symbolic links.

    This security update resolves a vulnerability in Microsoft Windows. The vulnerability could allow elevation of privilege if an attacker inserts a malicious USB device into a target system.

    This security update is rated Important for all supported releases of Microsoft Windows.

    Consequence
    Successfully exploiting the vulnerability might allow a local attacker to write a malicious binary to disk and execute it.
    Solution
    Refer to Microsoft Security Bulletin MS15-085 for details.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS15-085 Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-085 Windows 10 for x64-based Systems
    MS15-085 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-085 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1

    MS15-085 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-085 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2

    MS15-085 Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2

  • Microsoft UDDI Services Privilege Elevation Vulnerability (MS15-087)

    Severity
    Critical 4
    Qualys ID
    91077
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-087
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-2475
    CVSS Scores
    Base 4.3 / Temporal 3.2
    Description
    An elevation of privilege exists in Microsoft Windows when the Universal Description, Discovery, and Integration (UDDI) Services improperly validate or sanitize the search parameter in a FRAME tag. An attacker who successfully exploits this vulnerability could leak authorization cookies or unexpectedly redirect a user to a malicious webpage.

    Microsoft has released a security update that addresses the vulnerability by correcting how the UDDI Services encode and validate the parameter.

    This security update is rated Important for all supported editions of Windows Server 2008, except Itanium editions.

    Consequence
    The vulnerability could allow elevation of privilege if an attacker engineered a cross-site scripting (XSS) scenario by inserting a malicious script into a webpage search parameter. A user would have to visit a specially crafted webpage where the malicious script would then be executed.
    Solution
    Refer to MS15-087 for more information.

    Workaround:
    Use a Web Application Firewall (WAF) to block requests to the following location:
    /uddi/search/frames.aspx

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS15-087 Microsoft BizTalk Server 2010
    MS15-087 Microsoft BizTalk Server 2013
    MS15-087 Microsoft BizTalk Server 2013 R2
    MS15-087 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-087 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-087 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-087 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2

  • Microsoft Windows Command Line Parameter Passing Information Disclosure Vulnerability (MS15-088)

    Severity
    Serious 3
    Qualys ID
    91078
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-088
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-2423
    CVSS Scores
    Base 4.3 / Temporal 3.2
    Description
    An information disclosure vulnerability exists in Microsoft Windows, Internet Explorer, and Microsoft Office when files at a medium integrity level become accessible to Internet Explorer running in Enhanced Protection Mode (EPM).

    This security update helps to resolve an information disclosure vulnerability in Microsoft Windows, Internet Explorer, and Microsoft Office.

    This security update is rated Important for all supported releases of Microsoft Windows.

    Consequence
    Successfully exploiting these vulnerabilities might allow a remote attacker to obtain information in an attempt to further compromise the affected system.
    Solution
    Refer to Microsoft Security Bulletin MS15-088 for details.

  • Microsoft WebDAV Information Disclosure Vulnerability (MS15-089)

    Severity
    Critical 4
    Qualys ID
    91086
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-089
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-2476
    CVSS Scores
    Base 2.6 / Temporal 1.9
    Description
    An information disclosure vulnerability exists in the Microsoft Web Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV) client that is caused when it explicitly allows the use of Secure Socket Layer (SSL) 2.0.

    This security update is rated Important.

    Consequence
    An attacker who successfully exploits this vulnerability can decrypt portions of encrypted traffic.
    Solution
    Refer to Microsoft Security Bulletin MS15-089 for details.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS15-089 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-089 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-089 Windows 8 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-089 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems
    MS15-089 Windows 8.1 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-089 Windows 8.1 for x64-based Systems
    MS15-089 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS15-089 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-089 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS15-089 Windows Server 2012
    MS15-089 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS15-089 Windows Vista Service Pack 2

  • Microsoft Edge Cumulative Security Update (MS15-091)

    Severity
    Critical 4
    Qualys ID
    91082
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-091
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-2441, CVE-2015-2442, CVE-2015-2446, CVE-2015-2449
    CVSS Scores
    Base 9.3 / Temporal 6.9
    Description
    Microsoft Edge is a web browser developed by Microsoft.

    Microsoft Edge browser is exposed to multiple memory corruption vulnerabilities that might lead to remote code execution (CVE-2015-2441,CVE-2015-2442,CVE-2015-2446).

    A security feature bypass vulnerability exists when Microsoft Edge fails to use the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) security feature, allowing an attacker to more reliably predict the memory offsets of specific instructions in a given call stack (CVE-2015-2449).

    This security update is rated Critical for Microsoft Edge on affected Windows clients

    Consequence
    Successfully exploiting these vulnerabilities might allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause information leakage.
    Solution
    Refer to Microsoft Security Bulletin MS15-091 for details.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS15-091 Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems
    MS15-091 Windows 10 for x64-based Systems

  • Microsoft .NET Framework Elevation of Privilege and Denial of Service Vulnerability (MS15-092)

    Severity
    Serious 3
    Qualys ID
    91084
    Vendor Reference
    MS15-092
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2015-2479, CVE-2015-2480, CVE-2015-2481
    CVSS Scores
    Base 9.3 / Temporal 6.9
    Description
    The Microsoft .NET Framework is a software framework for computers running Microsoft Windows operating systems.

    Multiple elevation of privilege vulnerabilities exist in Microsoft .NET Framework when the RyuJIT compiler improperly optimizes certain parameters resulting in a code generation error. An attacker who successfully exploits this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system (CVE-2015-2479,CVE-2015-2480,CVE-2015-2481).

    This security update is rated Important for Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6 on all supported releases of Microsoft Windows except Itanium editions.

    Consequence
    Successfully exploiting this vulnerability might allow an attacker to gain escalated privileges or cause denial-of-service like conditions.
    Solution
    Refer to MS15-092 for further information.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS15-092 Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows 10 for x64-based Systems(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows 8 for 32-bit Systems(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows 8.1 for 32-bit Systems(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows 8.1 for x64-based Systems(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1 (Server Core installation)(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2 (Server Core installation)(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2 (Server Core installation)(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows Server 2012(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows Server 2012 (Server Core installation)(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows Server 2012 R2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows Server 2012 R2 (Server Core installation)(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows Vista Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)
    MS15-092 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6)

These new vulnerability checks are included in Qualys vulnerability signature 2.3.85-4. Each Qualys account is automatically updated with the latest vulnerability signatures as they become available. To view the vulnerability signature version in your account, from the Qualys Help menu, select the About tab.

Selective Scan Instructions Using Qualys

To perform a selective vulnerability scan, configure a scan profile to use the following options:

  1. Ensure access to TCP ports 135 and 139 are available.
  2. Enable Windows Authentication (specify Authentication Records).
  3. Enable the following Qualys IDs:
    • 91076
    • 91083
    • 100247
    • 91085
    • 110258
    • 91081
    • 91080
    • 123796
    • 91079
    • 91077
    • 91078
    • 91086
    • 91082
    • 91084
  4. If you would like the scan to return the Windows Hostname, also include QID 82044 and ensure access to UDP port 137 is available.
  5. If you would like to be notified if Qualys is unable to log on to a host (if Authentication fails), also include QID 105015.

In addition, prior to running a scan for these new vulnerabilities, you can estimate your exposure to these new threats by running the Risk Analysis Report, available from the Qualys Vulnerability Management Reports tab.

About Qualys

The Enterprise TruRisk Platform and its integrated suite of security and compliance applications provides organizations of all sizes with a global view of their security and compliance solutions, while drastically reducing their total cost of ownership. Qualys solutions include: continuous monitoring, vulnerability management, policy compliance, PCI compliance, security assessment questionnaire, web application scanning, web application firewall, malware detection and SECURE Seal for security testing of web sites.

Is your web server's SSL/TLS configuration secure? Find out for free.

See the power of Qualys, instantly. We don’t use the domain names or the test results, and we never will.
